local_schema.short_desc: Maximum image size for thumbnailing
local_schema.longdesc: Images over this size (in bytes) won't be thumbnailed. The purpose of this setting is to avoid thumbnailing large images that may take a long time to load or use lots of memory.

local_schema.short_desc: Current Caja theme (deprecated)
local_schema.longdesc: Name of the Caja theme to use. This has been deprecated as of Caja 2.2. Please use the icon theme instead.

local_schema.short_desc: Show toolbar in new windows
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, newly opened windows will have toolbars visible.

local_schema.short_desc: Show status bar in new windows
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, newly opened windows will have the status bar visible.

local_schema.short_desc: Show side pane in new windows
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, newly opened windows will have the side pane visible.

local_schema.short_desc: Show location bar in new windows
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, newly opened windows will have the location bar visible.

local_schema.short_desc: Show folders first in windows
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then Caja shows folders prior to showing files in the icon and list views.

local_schema.short_desc: Width of the side pane
local_schema.longdesc: The default width of the side pane in new windows.

local_schema.short_desc: Side pane view
local_schema.longdesc: The side pane view to show in newly opened windows.

local_schema.short_desc: Custom Side Pane Background Set
local_schema.longdesc: Whether a custom default side pane background has been set.

local_schema.short_desc: Default Side Pane Background Filename
local_schema.longdesc: Filename for the default side pane background. Only used if side_pane_background_set is true.

local_schema.short_desc: Default Side Pane Background Color
local_schema.longdesc: Filename for the default side pane background. Only used if side_pane_background_set is true.

local_schema.short_desc: When to show thumbnails of image files
local_schema.longdesc: Speed tradeoff for when to show an image file as a thumbnail. If set to "always" then always thumbnail, even if the folder is on a remote server. If set to "local_only" then only show thumbnails for local file systems. If set to "never" then never bother to thumbnail images, just use a generic icon.

local_schema.short_desc: When to show preview text in icons
local_schema.longdesc: Speed tradeoff for when to show a preview of text file contents in the file's icon. If set to "always" then always show previews, even if the folder is on a remote server. If set to "local_only" then only show previews for local file systems. If set to "never" then never bother to read preview data.

local_schema.short_desc: When to show number of items in a folder
local_schema.longdesc: Speed tradeoff for when to show the number of items in a folder. If set to "always" then always show item counts, even if the folder is on a remote server. If set to "local_only" then only show counts for local file systems. If set to "never" then never bother to compute item counts.

local_schema.short_desc: Caja handles drawing the desktop
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then Caja will draw the icons on the desktop.

local_schema.short_desc: Show advanced permissions in the file property dialog
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then Caja lets you edit and display file permissions in a more unix-like way, accessing some more esoteric options.

local_schema.short_desc: Criteria for search bar searching
local_schema.longdesc: Criteria when matching files searched for in the search bar. If set to "search_by_text", then Caja will Search for files by file name only. If set to "search_by_text_and_properties", then Caja will search for files by file name and file properties.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to preview sounds when mousing over an icon
local_schema.longdesc: Speed tradeoff for when to preview a sound file when mousing over a files icon. If set to "always" then always plays the sound, even if the file is on a remote server. If set to "local_only" then only plays previews on local file systems. If set to "never" then it never previews sound.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether the navigation window should be maximized.
local_schema.longdesc: Whether the navigation window should be maximized by default.

local_schema.short_desc: The geometry string for a navigation window.
local_schema.longdesc: A string containing the saved geometry and coordinates string for navigation windows.

local_schema.short_desc: Use extra mouse button events in Caja' browser window
local_schema.longdesc: For users with mice that have "Forward" and "Back" buttons, this key will determine if any action is taken inside of Caja when either is pressed.

local_schema.short_desc: Mouse button to activate the "Forward" command in browser window
local_schema.longdesc: For users with mice that have buttons for "Forward" and "Back", this key will set which button activates the "Forward" command in a browser window. Possible values range between 6 and 14.

local_schema.short_desc: Mouse button to activate the "Back" command in browser window
local_schema.longdesc: For users with mice that have buttons for "Forward" and "Back", this key will set which button activates the "Back" command in a browser window. Possible values range between 6 and 14.

local_schema.short_desc: List of x-content/* types where the preferred application will be launched
local_schema.longdesc: List of x-content/* types for which the user have chosen to start an application in the preference capplet. The preferred application for the given type will be started on insertion on media matching these types.

local_schema.short_desc: List of x-content/* types set to "Open Folder"
local_schema.longdesc: List of x-content/* types for which the user have chosen "Open Folder" in the preferences capplet. A folder window will be opened on insertion of media matching these types.

local_schema.short_desc: List of x-content/* types set to "Do Nothing"
local_schema.longdesc: List of x-content/* types for which the user have chosen "Do Nothing" in the preference capplet. No prompt will be shown nor will any matching application be started on insertion of media matching these types.

local_schema.short_desc: Never prompt or autorun/autostart programs when media are inserted
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then Caja will never prompt nor autorun/autostart programs when a medium is inserted.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to automatically open a folder for automounted media
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then Caja will automatically open a folder when media is automounted. This only applies to media where no known x-content/* type was detected; for media where a known x-content type is detected, the user configurable action will be taken instead.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to automatically mount media
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then Caja will automatically mount media such as user-visible hard disks and removable media on start-up and media insertion.

local_schema.short_desc: Show the package installer for unknown mime types
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to show the user a package installer dialog in case an unknown mime type is opened, in order to search for an application to handle it.

local_schema.short_desc: Caja will exit when last window destroyed.
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then Caja will exit when all windows are destroyed. This is the default setting. If set to false, it can be started without any window, so caja can serve as a daemon to monitor media automount, or similar tasks.

local_schema.short_desc: What to do with executable text files when activated
local_schema.longdesc: What to do with executable text files when they are activated (single or double clicked). Possible values are "launch" to launch them as programs, "ask" to ask what to do via a dialog, and "display" to display them as text files.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to enable immediate deletion
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then Caja will have a feature allowing you to delete a file immediately and in-place, instead of moving it to the trash. This feature can be dangerous, so use caution.

local_schema.short_desc: Maximum handled files in a folder
local_schema.longdesc: Folders over this size will be truncated to around this size. The purpose of this is to avoid unintentionally blowing the heap and killing Caja on massive folders. A negative value denotes no limit. The limit is approximate due to the reading of folders chunk-wise.

local_schema.short_desc: Caja uses the users home folder as the desktop
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then Caja will use the user's home folder as the desktop. If it is false, then it will use ~/Desktop as the desktop.

local_schema.short_desc: Desktop font
local_schema.longdesc: The font description used for the icons on the desktop.

local_schema.short_desc: Default folder viewer
local_schema.longdesc: When a folder is visited this viewer is used unless you have selected another view for that particular folder. Possible values are "list_view", "icon_view" and "compact_view".

local_schema.short_desc: Date Format
local_schema.longdesc: The format of file dates. Possible values are "locale", "iso", and "informal".

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to ask for confirmation when deleting files, or emptying Trash
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then Caja will ask for confirmation when you attempt to delete files, or empty the Trash.

local_schema.short_desc: Type of click used to launch/open files
local_schema.longdesc: Possible values are "single" to launch files on a single click, or "double" to launch them on a double click.

local_schema.short_desc: Custom Background
local_schema.longdesc: Whether a custom default folder background has been set.

local_schema.short_desc: Default Background Filename
local_schema.longdesc: Filename for the default folder background. Only used if background_set is true.

local_schema.short_desc: Default Background Color
local_schema.longdesc: Color for the default folder background. Only used if background_set is true.

local_schema.short_desc: Always use the location entry, instead of the pathbar
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then Caja browser windows will always use a textual input entry for the location toolbar, instead of the pathbar.

local_schema.short_desc: Enables the classic Caja behavior, where all windows are browsers
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then all Caja windows will be browser windows. This is how Caja used to behave before version 2.6, and some people prefer this behavior.
